intro: Narvalina domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican narval, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Narvalina domingensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure.
